Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially light-brown in section, the interior is slightly ribbed and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of black-painted text. Joint to EA 66292.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393833) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393833)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (fig.27)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Gr. 1 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
